intro: Hieracium glomerosum, commonly known as the clustered hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring sunny to partially shaded conditions. Its flowers are yellow and arranged in dense clusters, with phyllaries that are often reddish or purple in color. Hieracium glomerosum is an herbaceous perennial that can spread through rhizomes, forming dense colonies in suitable habitats.
